description.narrative: (i) Address housing deficit: Colombia''s current deficit stands at 1.3 mm units that grows at 140,000 units per year. The Project will contribute to address the increasing deficit by supporting the development of 5 to 10 projects in a five period; (ii) Address shortage in housing supply: Colombian homebuilders face constraints in obtaining medium- to long-term financing, especially equity to finance land acquisition. This issue constraints the ability for homebuilders to develop larger projects and is one of the main reasons why the number of housing units built every year is not enough to address the increasing deficit. The Project will help Triada to develop larger scale projects; (iii) Alignment with Government''s priority: Housing is one of the strategic pillars of the government. President Santos is setting up the framework and designing the incentives to increase the stock of new units by 250,000 per year. The Project will be aligned with the government''s strategic priorities for the period 2012-2014 and will benefit of the incentives that the government will make available to foster housing supply.

The Project consists on the development of approx. 5-10 Low Income Housing (LIH) projects in Colombia. Triada S.A.S (Triada or the Company) will be responsible for developing all housing projects under this investment.
